page.title: 20Odcombe V.A. Primary School
page.content: The school has been here for just over 150 years. The long Victorian building is of Ham-stone and is divided into two classes. A modern, additional classroom and small playground are reached by stairs. Behind the school there is a lawn with a small pond and a large oak tree, planted by previous pupils. There are 52 children, most from the village and some from the nearby navy camp. There are three teacher and one part timer. About a dozen children have dinners brought from a secondary school kitchen but most children bring a packed lunch. Many village schools are under threat of closure on economic grounds - both Odcombe and Montacute (which is a smaller school) have so far been lucky.
